intro: Elatostema tenuistipulatum, commonly known as the slender-tipped elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a typical feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. Elatostema tenuistipulatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
